bioghist.p: The Newsboys' Aid Society was a charity organized to provide housing and moral instruction for destitute boys. It was established in 1858 and closed in 1861. The Society was located at 221 Spruce Street in Philadelphia, and the Superintendent was Alexander Sloan.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of superintendent's records of the Newsboys' Aid Society, from May 29th, 1858, to June 15, 1861. A second volume contains nearly duplicate entries for the dates July 1st, 1858, to Dec. 19th, 1859. Daily entries record the number of boarders, their comportment, and any visitors and activities.
